verses.text:
The Lord will come, the earth shall quake,
The hills their fixed seat forsake;
And, withering from the vault of night,
The stars shall pale their feeble light.

The Lord will come, but not the same
As once in lowly form he came;
A silent lamb before his foes,
A weary man of grief and woes.

The Lord will come, a dreadful form,
With rainbow, wreath, and robe of storm;
On cherubs' wings, and wings of wind,
Appointed judge of all mankind.

Can this be he who wont to stray
A pilgrim on the world's highway,
By power oppressed and mocked by pride,
The Nazarene, the crucified?

O sinners, seek his mercy now!
O bend to him the stubborn brow!
Let every knee to him be bent,
Till his avenging arm, relent!
